incidents.name: Super SIM Network Connectivity Issues

incident_updates.body: The issue related to Super SIM failures has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

Between ~10:20 UTC and 14:20 UTC, connectivity on one of Super SIM's downstream connectivity partners was impacted. We observed ~26% decline in the number of devices connecting via the IMSI corresponding to those impacted partner. During this period, we observed an increase in the number of connections on other Super SIM IMSIs indicating that many devices reconnecting after the Super SIMs failed over to the other IMSIs on the SIM, reducing the overall impact. If you still have devices offline, try resetting the SIM's connectivity from the Twilio Console or restarting your device. We will provide an update in 2 hours, or as more information becomes available.

We continue experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

Since 10:20AM UTC we are experiencing Super SIM connectivity issues. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on 8% of Super SIM Devices

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved with regard to Super SIM on one of the sponsors being dropped.

Beginning at 8:32 UTC, we observed 8% of active data sessions on Super SIM on one of the sponsors being dropped. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. Our engineering team is actively working on identifying and resolving the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue supersim. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with transcriptions. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

incidents.name: Encoding Issue for Worker Attributes in Flex

incident_updates.body: Flex was degraded between 07:51 UTC on 07/19/2024 and 05:15pm UTC on 07/26/2024. During this period, customers may have experienced issues with tasks being assigned to workers in the event the workers had special characters as part of their attribute skills and updated these skills during the impact window. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Super Sim Was Affected

incident_updates.body: Between 22:10 and 22:25 UTC we investigated an issue where devices using Super SIM may have experienced delays in attaching to the network. The SIM needed to failover to another IMSI in order to successfully attach to the network. We are actively monitoring the situation and working with our partner to understand what happened. We will provide another update if more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super Sim. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Programmable Messaging API Was Affected

incident_updates.body: The Twilio Programmable Messaging API was partially degraded starting from Jul 24th, 2024, 14:53 PST to 14:55 PST. During this time, customers sending messages may receive 5xx's in API responses. The system has recovered and is operational.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays and Failures to IT&E Network in US via a Subset of Short Codes

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to IT&E Network in US via a subset of short codes. This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS Short Code, North America

incident_updates.body: We are observing recovery in SMS delivery delays and failures when sending messages to IT&E Network in US via a subset of short codes. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS Short Code, North America

incident_updates.body: We continue to experience SMS delivery delays and failures when sending messages to IT&E Network in US via a subset of short codes. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
